annotation.summary: This section describes the prevalence and variety of magic items, highlighting the fusion of magic and technology known as magitech or hybrid tech. It emphasizes the accessibility of such items through modern and traditional marketplaces.
annotation.key_rules: No specific mechanical rules are provided; the text focuses on setting flavor and context for acquiring magic items.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; no actions or mechanics are described.
annotation.prerequisites: None mentioned; general availability of magic items is implied.
annotation.query: Overview of magic items and their availability in a magitech setting.

annotation.summary: This section describes the coexistence of technology and magic across the galaxy, highlighting the emergence of hybrid items that combine both magical and technological traits. It references tables listing item statistics and notes that each item has unique rules for activation or passive effects.
key_rules: Hybrid items possess both magical and technological traits.
Items vary in activation methods—some require specific actions, others provide constant benefits.
Tables list item details such as level, price, Bulk, and hands required.
annotation.action_economy: Some items require bespoke activations, while others function automatically without consuming actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to magic or technology capable of creating or using hybrid items.
annotation.query: What are hybrid items and how do they function in a tech-magic integrated setting?

annotation.summary: Investing magic items links them to a specific character, granting their magical benefits only when properly invested. A character can invest up to 10 items per day, though they can still use non-magical aspects without investment.
key_rules: Magic or hybrid items require investment to grant magical benefits.
Investment is performed using the 'Invest an Item' activity.
A character can have a maximum of 10 invested items per day.
Non-magical benefits of items function without investment.
annotation.action_economy: Uses the 'Invest an Item' activity, typically performed during daily preparations.
annotation.prerequisites: Possession of a magic or hybrid item capable of being invested.
annotation.query: How does investing magic items work and what are the limits?

annotation.summary: Investing an item allows a character to channel personal energy into a magical item with the invested trait, activating its constant magical effects while worn.
key_rules: Requires the item to have the invested trait.
Investment occurs as part of donning the item.
The process uses one or more Interact actions, typically matching the time needed to don the item.
The character gains the item's constant magical benefits while meeting its requirements.
The investment ends when the item is removed.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more Interact actions, usually equal to the time required to don the item.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess and wear an item with the invested trait.
annotation.query: How does investing an item work in gameplay?

annotation.summary: This rule defines how many magical or special items a character can invest in per day, how removing them affects the investment, and when the limit resets.
key_rules: A character can invest no more than 10 items per day.
Removing an invested item causes it to lose its investiture.
An item that loses investiture still counts against the daily limit until the next reset.
The daily limit resets during daily preparations.
Items still worn from the previous day can remain invested but still count toward the limit.
annotation.action_economy: Investment occurs during daily preparations; removing an item is a separate action that ends its investiture.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to invest items, typically granted by class or feature allowing item investment.
annotation.query: rules for investing and maintaining invested items per day

annotation.summary: Describes how certain items require deliberate activation to produce effects, specifying the number of actions and traits involved in their use.
key_rules: Some items provide constant benefits automatically.
Other items require activation to function.
The item's Activate entry lists the number of actions needed and relevant traits.
annotation.action_economy: Activation requires a specified number of actions as listed in the item's Activate entry.
annotation.prerequisites: Possession of the item and the ability to perform its listed activation.
annotation.query: How do you activate items that require an action in this TTRPG?

annotation.summary: Only a character who has personally invested an item can activate it.
key_rules: An item with the invested trait must be invested by the user to be activated.
prerequisites: The item must have the invested trait.
The user must have invested the item.

annotation.summary: Items with the manipulate trait can only be activated when the user is holding or touching them with a free hand.
key_rules: An item with a manipulate activation requires physical contact.
The user must either hold the item or touch it with a free hand to activate it.
annotation.action_economy: Depends on the item's activation entry; this rule only restricts activation conditions.
annotation.prerequisites: The user must have at least one free hand or be holding the item.
annotation.query: What are the requirements for activating an item with the manipulate trait?

annotation.summary: Describes how certain items have a limited number of activations per day, which reset during daily preparations, while their constant benefits remain active regardless of activation limits.
key_rules: Items may have a fixed number of activations per day.
Activations reset during daily preparations.
Constant benefits from the item persist even when activations are exhausted.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; focuses on daily activation limits rather than action types.
annotation.prerequisites: Possession of an item with limited activations.
annotation.query: How do limited activation items function and reset in daily preparations?

annotation.summary: Describes how to activate a magic item that uses the 'Cast a Spell' activation method, requiring the user to follow the same action and traits as the spell itself.
key_rules: If an item's activation lists 'Cast a Spell', use the same action as the spell to activate it.
A spellcasting class feature is required to activate such an item.
All normal traits and effects of the spell apply when cast through the item.
annotation.action_economy: Uses the same action type as the spell being cast (e.g., 1 action, 2 actions, or reaction).
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess a spellcasting class feature.
annotation.query: How do you activate an item that uses the 'Cast a Spell' activation method?
